intro: Adenocarpus complicatus subsp. graecus, commonly known as the Greek sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by twisted, woody pods that contain several seeds. The subspecies graecus is distinguished by its more compact growth habit and specific leaf morphology compared to other subspecies of Adenocarpus complicatus.
